snippet: A corruption case in Chongqing involves a Communist Party official, Bo Xilai; his vice mayor, Wang Lijun; and two tycoons, in a country that normally keeps rivalries under wraps.
abstract: Drama deepens in corruption case in Chongqing, China, involving high-ranking Communist Party official Bo Xilai and his vice mayor Wang Lijun after undercover police seize a fugitive real estate mogul claiming that Lijun had threatened him; growing political scandal appears to have tarnished Bo's carefully cultivated image and dashed his hopes for ascending to the highest echelon of Chinese leadership.

byline.original: By DAN LEVIN and MICHAEL WINES
byline.contributor: Jonathan Ansfield and Edward Wong contributed reporting, and Shi Da and Mia Li contributed research.

lead_paragraph: A corruption case in Chongqing involves a Communist Party official, Bo Xilai; his vice mayor, Wang Lijun; and two tycoons, in a country that normally keeps rivalries under wraps.

headline.seo: New Layers of Intrigue in Chinese Political Scandal
headline.main: Cast of Characters Grows, as Does the Intrigue, in a Chinese Political Scandal
headline.print_headline: Cast of Characters Grows, as Does the Intrigue, in a Chinese Political Scandal
